H0.text: Abrasion is the process that causes sand grains to stick together to form sandstone.

H1.text: Cementation is the process that causes sand grains to stick together to form sandstone.

H2.text: Combustion is the process that causes sand grains to stick together to form sandstone.

H3.text: Erosion is the process that causes sand grains to stick together to form sandstone.

A4.text: Cementation is a process where minerals bond grains of sediment together by growing around them. This means precipitation of ions carried in groundwater to form new crystalline material between sedimentary grains.

A5.text: In this way, sand becomes sandstone, and gravel becomes conglomerate or breccia.
